channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dog waste, 22nd February
item.description:
The cleaners picked up the dog waste over a week ago but left all this residue for people to keep walking through. This is a continuous problem that is never addressed unless we constantly raise it, do we not have street cleaners, why do we not have dog waste bins or even a normal street bin

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On the corner of Russell Square and Bedford Way, 22nd February
item.description:
This is a follow-up to the previously reported issue 8829553. The issue hasn’t been fixed. The spikes at the bottom of the tree are still covered in puke and litter, which has been there for months now. It never gets properly cleaned. It is unsanitary and unsafe for the public. I am once again asking for permission to remove the spikes (obviously without bringing any harm to the tree itself). Please advise if you are not authorised to give such a permission and if so, who I should reach out to instead. In the meantime, grateful if it can get properly cleaned. Thanks a lot in advance
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bedford Way, St Pancras, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbours fly-tipping, 22nd February
item.description:
Residents of 33 Oakhouse Road, Bexleyheath DA6 7NA have been seen around 2am using trolleys to load up rubbish and dump it at the top of our road on Albion Road as identified on the marker. This has now been reported multiple times this past 2 months with no action taken
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albion Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Furniture and rubbish dumped on pavement, 22nd February
item.description:
There is furniture and rubbish dumped by the side wall of the cafe which is partially blocking the pavement. It has been present for at least a week and the pile is quickly being added to.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forman Place, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
